newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY RETAIL GAS PRICES RISE 3.6PCT. [CORRECTED 15:45 GMT]
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY RETAIL GAS PRICES RISE 3.6PCT. [CORRECTED 15:45 GMT]

text.p: Hungary's Ministry of Industry and Trade said on Tuesday Hungarian gas retail prices will rise by 3.6 percent with immediate effect, matching a similar rise for electricity announced last Friday.
"The rise for gas from April 1 will be the same as for electricity," head of the the ministry's energy department Pal Ligeti told Reuters.
The ministry of trade and industry said on Friday the consumer price for electricity would rise by 3.6 percent to cover the devaluation of the forint in the first quarter of 1997.

Ligeti said earlier negotiations with the energy companies over their concerns that consumer prices were not ensuring an adequate return on investment were continuing. He added that any price adjustments resulting fron the talks would be incorporated into June or September rises.
The April 1 increase is the first stemming from a new system in which electricity prices are adjusted quarterly.

The electricity and gas distribution companies, in which West European giants such as RWE , Electricite de France, Gaz de France and Italgas have large stakes, claim the January consumer price rises -- 18.8 percent for gas and 24.9 percent for electricity -- failed to provide the eight percent profit margin agreed when they bought into the sector in December 1995.
(Corrects to add different consumer price rise for gas)
